channel.title: CVE Feed for yithemes -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for yithemes -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-4455|2024-08-01T20:40:47.133Z -- yithemes -- yith%20woocommerce%20ajax%20search
item.description: The YITH WooCommerce Ajax Search plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘item’ parameter in versions up to, and including, 2.4.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-6799|2024-07-22T20:11:22.485Z -- yithemes -- yith%20essential%20kit%20for%20woocommerce%20%231
item.description: The YITH Essential Kit for WooCommerce #1 plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the 'activate_module', 'deactivate_module', and 'install_module' functions in all versions up to, and including, 2.34.0. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to install, activate, and deactivate plugins from a pre-defined list of available YITH plugins.

item.title: CVE-2024-0870|2024-05-14T02:38:18.778Z -- yithemes -- yith%20woocommerce%20gift%20cards
item.description: The YITH WooCommerce Gift Cards plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the 'save_mail_status' and 'save_email_settings' functions in all versions up to, and including, 4.12.0. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to modify WooCommerce settings.

item.title: CVE-2024-4455|2024-06-04T17:54:26.555Z -- yithemes -- yith%20woocommerce%20ajax%20search
item.description: The YITH WooCommerce Ajax Search plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘item’ parameter in versions up to, and including, 2.4.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. item.description: The YITH WooCommerce Gift Cards plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the 'save_mail_status' and 'save_email_settings' functions in all versions up to, and including, 4.12.0. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to modify WooCommerce settings.
